snippet: A federal judge in Cincinnati declared Friday that he would require Ohio to recognize same-sex marriages performed legally in other states.
abstract: Timothy S Black, federal judge in Cincinnati, declares that he will require Ohio to recognize same-sex marriages performed legally in other states; says he will issue written ruling stating that Ohio’s refusal to recognize valid same-sex marriages violated constitutional protections; move is latest in series of court decisions around the nation overturning restrictive state marriage laws and amendments.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge in Cincinnati declared Friday that he would require Ohio to recognize same-sex marriages performed legally in other states.

headline.main: Judge Says Ohio Must Recognize Same-Sex Marriages Performed Out of State
headline.print_headline: Judge Says Ohio Must Recognize Same-Sex Marriages Performed Out of State

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
